column1: - Allergic reaction - Cancer - Drug reaction - Harmless (benign) cyst - Hernia (a soft, large bulge in the groin on one or both sides) - Infections in the legs - Injury to the groin area - Lipomas (harmless fatty growths) - Sexually transmitted diseases such as genital herpes, chlamydia, and gonorrhea - Swollen lymph glands in the groin area
Make an appointment to see your health care provider if you have an unexplained groin lump, especially if it lasts for more than 3 weeks.
